[cloudconvert](https://cloudconvert.com/wav-converter) - convert sound clips to mono wav (pcm_s16le, 128, mono, no change, 22050hz)

```bash
sudo apt install python3-pip
pip install numpy
pip install scipy
python3 process.py ./samples/sfxCoin.wav 50
python3 process.py ./samples/sfxJumpSmall.wav 50
python3 process.py ./samples/sfxJumpSuper.wav 50
python3 process.py ./samples/sfxOneUp.wav 50
python3 process.py ./samples/sfxPipe.wav 50
python3 process.py ./samples/sfxPowerUp.wav 50
```

At 50ms per segment (i.e. 20 segments per second):

```
sfxCoin      = [980.4446460980035, 980.4446460980035, 1320.5989110707803, 1320.5989110707803, 1320.5989110707803, 1320.5989110707803, 1320.5989110707803, 1320.5989110707803, 1320.5989110707803, 1320.5989110707803, 1320.5989110707803, 1320.5989110707803, 1320.5989110707803, 1320.5989110707803, 1320.5989110707803, 1320.5989110707803, 1320.5989110707803, 1320.5989110707803]
```

Rounded:

```
sfxCoin      = [980, 980, 1321, 1321, 1321, 1321, 1321, 1321, 1321, 1321, 1321, 1321, 1321, 1321, 1321, 1321, 1321, 1321]

```
